medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Diarrhea with loose, unformed stools developed 1 year prior to presentation, occurring up to six times per day, associated with urgency and mild abdominal discomfort. In the 4 months preceding the presentation, there was unintentional weight loss of approximately 10 kg and increasing fatigue. Symptoms did not worsen after eating dairy or wheat products.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of asthma; previous excision of a congenital nevus and inguinal herniorrhaphy. Allergic to penicillin.
medical_history.family_history: Late grandfather had hypertension; late father had diabetes mellitus, thyroid disease, nephrolithiasis, rheumatoid arthritis, asthma, and hypertension. Brother and half-siblings were healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Single; worked in a retail store. No known exposure to sexually transmitted diseases or hepatitis.
